file_handler module¶

Contains the methods to handle xml and png files representing the automata.

file_handler.load_xml(filepath)[source]¶

Loads an automaton from an xml file.

Parameters:filepath (str) – the path of the xml file representing the automaton
Returns:the automaton represented by the xml file, or an error message if its validation fails
Return type:Automaton or str
file_handler.save_automata_files(level, compact, save_source, bad_twin=None, good_twin=None, synchronized=None)[source]¶

Saves xml and png files representing the automata.

Only not None automata will be saved.

Parameters:
  • level (int) – the current automata level
  • compact (bool) – whether to render transitions in compact mode or in complete mode
  • save_source (bool) – whether to save source files of the graphical representation
  • bad_twin (Automaton or None) – the current level bad twin
  • good_twin (Automaton or None) – the current level good twin
  • synchronized (Automaton or None) – the current level synchronized automaton
file_handler.save_file(filename, content)[source]¶

Saves a text file.

Parameters:
  • filename (str) – the name of the file
  • content (str) – the text to save into the file
file_handler.save_img(automaton, title, file_name, compact, save_source)[source]¶

Saves the graphical representation of the automaton into a png file.

Parameters:
  • automaton (Automaton) – the automaton to be saved
  • title (str) – the title to be displayed in the png file
  • file_name (str) – the name of the file to be saved
  • compact (bool) – whether to render transitions in compact mode or in complete mode
  • save_source (bool) – whether to save source files of the graphical representation
file_handler.save_xml(automaton, filename)[source]¶

Saves an automaton into an xml file.

Parameters:
  • automaton (Automaton) – the automaton to be saved
  • filename – the name of the xml file
Rtype filename:

str
file_handler.validate_language_semantics(automaton)[source]¶

Validates the language semantics.

It uses the automaton function that checks if the language is alive.

Parameters:automaton (Automaton) – the automaton to be checked
Returns:true if the xml semantics is correct, otherwise the error message
Return type:bool or str
file_handler.validate_syntax(filepath)[source]¶

Validates the xml syntax according the xml schema used to represent the automaton.

An xml is considered syntactically valid if it contains:
  • <automaton> as root
  • <states> as first child of <automaton>
  • a list of <state> as child of <states>, containing #text and the optional attribute initial=”true”
  • <transitions> as second child of <automaton>
  • a list of <transition> as child of <transitions>, containing the optional attributes observable=”true” and fault=”true”
  • <source> as child of <transition>, containing #text
  • <event> as optional child of <transition>, containing #text
  • <destination> as child of <transition>, containing #text
Parameters:filepath (str) – the path of the xml file representing the automaton structure.
Returns:true if the xml syntax is correct, otherwise the error message
Return type:bool or str
file_handler.validate_xml_semantics(filepath)[source]¶

Validates the xml semantics according to the definition of the automaton.

An xml is considered semantically valid if:
  • it contains exactly one <state> with attribute initial=”true”
  • none of its <state> contain the special character ‘,’ in their #text
  • it contains at least a <transition> with attribute observable=”true”
  • it contains at least a <transition> with attribute fault=”true”
  • none of its <transition> have more than one attribute
  • only <transition> with attribute observable=”true” must have the associated <event>
  • none of its <event> contain the special characters ‘//’ and ‘+’ in their #text
Parameters:filepath (str) – the path of the xml file representing the automaton
Returns:true if the xml semantics is correct, otherwise the error message
Return type:bool or str
